definition: special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex

sentences.english: Gabrielle: Trust me, it was a steal.
If you take it over the weekend, the weekend rental special is $150.00.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想週末要的話，週末的特價是150美元。

sentences.english: It follows that people prefer a pricing policy where they can find bargains on specific items.
sentences.chinese: 這說明人們喜歡可以找到特價商品的價格政策。

sentences.english: It lets you buy a slice of America’s future at a marked-down price.
sentences.chinese: 它可以讓你以特價購買到美國的一份未來。

sentences.english: These things are all on sale.
They have a special offer on car rentals this month.
sentences.chinese: 這個月他們還有租車的特價優惠。

sentences.english: We have many fly-drive bargain still available.
sentences.chinese: 我們仍有多種特價空陸聯遊項目。

sentences.english: Do you have any pizzas on sale today?
This offer is not applicable to special and net priced items.
sentences.chinese: 上述優惠不適用於特價品或折實價貨品。

sentences.english: We have a special on a midsize car.
sentences.chinese: 我們有一型中型車正在特價優惠。

sentences.english: Can you make us a special offer based on a quantity of 5000M/T?
sentences.chinese: 以5000公噸的數量爲基礎，貴公司能給特價嗎？

sentences.english: The dumpling and soup is 10 RMB.
sentences.chinese: 餃子加湯的午餐特價是10元人民幣。
剛出爐的小餐包正在特價中。

definition: buy one, get one free/two for the price of one
to place an order/to order/an order (of goods)
group buying/collective buying/buying by a group of individuals who negotiate a discount for the group
